news.title: Fine Gael’s Mairead McGuinness pulls out of presidential race
news.summary: Fine Gael’s Mairead McGuinness is to withdraw from the presidential election race on health grounds.

news.title: ‘I do not want you to be consumed by guilt’ – father of girl who died with mother in crash writes letter to comfort lorry driver
news.summary: The father of a little girl who died alongside her mother in a fatal collision between their car and a lorry, wrote a letter offering his “heartfelt support” to the lorry driver.

news.title: Drew Harris showed ‘utter contempt’ for some gardaí by ‘drip-leaking’ lines of report, GRA says
news.summary: The Garda Representative Association (GRA) has said Commissioner Drew Harris showed “utter contempt” for members of roads policing units by “drip-leaking” parts of the Crowe report.

news.title: Martha Nolan-O’Slat­arra’s family seek second post-mortem as mother and sister prepare to bring body home from US
news.summary: The family of a young Irish woman found dead on a boat in the US are seeking a second-opinion post-mortem ­examination to determine the cause of her death.

news.title: Daniel McDonnell: What the next FAI chief football officer needs to know after ill-fated Marc Canham tenure
news.summary: The FAI are at an advanced stage of identifying a replacement for chief football officer Marc Canham, a topical development in the context of last week’s board decision to give up on plans to bring in a new aligned calendar.

news.title: Indian woman brutally beaten and called ‘foreign b****’ while celebrating Kerry’s All-Ireland
news.summary: Sonali Flynn has lived in Ireland since 1999 and never suffered racial abuse or a racist attack. This all changed when Sonali and her friends were out celebrating Kerry’s All-Ireland victory in Tralee on July 27.

news.title: Presidential hopeful Gareth Sheridan claims there is ‘coordinated attack’ on his character by people in ‘Seán Gallagher circle’
news.summary: Presidential hopeful Gareth Sheridan has opened his campaign by claiming there is a “coordinated attack” on his character “by people associated with and in the Seán Gallagher circle”.

news.title: New mother awarded €50,000 after being denied part-time hours in WRC discrimination case
news.summary: A security firm which refused to let a new mother come back to work on part-time hours after having her first baby has been ordered to pay her €50,000 in compensation for discrimination.

news.title: Mary Kenny: Legion of Mary did more for unwed mothers and their babies than anyone – now the State is demanding redress
news.summary: Some people don't much like the Legion of Mary, the Irish and international faith organisation dedicated to the Blessed Virgin. There have always been dismissive jokes about the ‘holy Joe’ types who evangelise and perform charitable works.

news.title: Declan Lynch: ‘In the future, everyone will host Liveline for 15 minutes’
news.summary: A few weeks ago, Philip Boucher-Hayes was the first out of the proverbial landing craft and on to the beaches, starting the battle to become the full-time presenter of  Liveline  (RTÉ1, weekdays, 1.45pm).
